page.title: 04HASTINGS COUNTRY PARK E.S.
page.content:
Hastings Country Park covers 500 acres along the coast from Hastings to Fairlight village, East Sussex. Farmland borders the park to the north, and to the south vertical cliffs face the sea. The clifftop is fenced off and there are warning signs {DANGEROUS CLIFFS.} Deciduous woods grow in the steep valleys and gorse and heather cover the remaining land. Many footpaths criss-cross the Park and it is a very popular dog-walking area for both visitors and the local people. Public toilets and a car park are provided, by Fairlight Church
There is a Coastguard Lookout point at the eastern end of the Park, with an excellent view of the Channel, and the coastline to the east to Rye, Camber Sands and Dungeness Nuclear Power Station.
